results.title: A Salute to Billie Holiday = A Tribute to Billie Holiday
results.brief_description: Performed live at the Hollywood Bowl, this made for television production features five highly acclaimed and recognised American female jazz and blues singers who present their own unique interpretations of several memorable songs by legendary blues singer, Billie Holiday. Set to a 32-piece orchestra, arranged and conducted by Ray Ellis, these five wonderful women, Maxine Weldon, Morgana King, Carmen McCrae, Nina Simone and Esther Phillips, each give a stunning performance climaxing with all five singing together on stage. The program is interspersed with two pieces of rare archival footage (1935 and 1950) of the “Lady” in action along with personal commentary by Maxine Weldon and Morgana King. Great music and of historical value. NB: Picture and sound quality poor but still worth viewing.

results.title: A Sailor is born
results.creator_credit: Editorial Film Productions and Jim Mellor
results.brief_description: Follows the career of a typical Royal Navy recruit and thereby illustrates the scope and thoroughness of the training methods of the Navy.

results.title: A Safe place
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Anne Whitehead and Robyn Cooney
results.brief_description: The prevention of child accidents in the home. Begins in the hospital, with the treatment of children in accidents, then broadens to a general look at the development of children in the first few years of growth, their capabilities, and perception of their environment, and potential for accident situations. Looks at ways of reducing risks to create a safe home environment.

results.title: A Run for your money
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates and Charles Cahill
results.brief_description: A Japanese uses about one quarter of the energy used by an American. When fuel economy counts, it is important to watch driving habits, it is also important to use smaller cars, not carry heavy things unless necessary, not over utilise air conditioning and make sure that the cars used receive regular maintenance.

results.title: A Rosewood daydream
results.brief_description: This is the name of a Toronto folk group - two young men, a blue-eyed woman, and a guitar. They sing outdoors, indoors, wherever there’s a friendly audience. Most of the “with it” listeners in this film are the old folks in a home for the aged in St. John’s, Newfoundland. To them the group sings old songs of the sea, and a popular tune, Louis Collins, by Mississippi John Hurt.

results.title: A Rose for Emily
results.creator_credit: Chubbuck Cinema Company, Lyndon Chubbuck and H Kaye Dyal
results.brief_description: When Miss Emily Grierson, the town’s aristocrat, was young, her tyrannical father drove her suitors away. After his death, Emily succumbed to the advances of a man beneath her station and this film shows the consequences of this event. This film is a twentieth century Gothic tale dealing in the mysterious and the macabre and is of interest to both film and literature classes. Stars Angelica Huston and John Carradine and adapted from the short story by William Faulkner. Narrated by John Houseman.

results.title: A Room with a view
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions, Ismail Merchant and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Based on E M Forster’s classic novel, this film tells the story of a young English couple who encounter passion in Italy and, defying the Victorian conventions of their elders, dare to be true to their emotions and each other. Stars Helena Bonham-Carter, Maggie Smith, Denholm Elliot and Julian Sands.

results.title: A room for Romeo Brass
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, BBC Film Unit, George Faber, Charles Pattinson and Shane Meadows
results.brief_description: Shane Meadows writes and directs this drama about two young boys’ friendship and their coming-of-age. Neighbours, the boys share life experiences (and porno magazines) and support each other as one is physically unwell and the other’s parents have separated. The friendship is tested however when a creepy stranger manipulates his way into their lives by trying to date the attractive older sister of Romeo. Tensions arise as the stranger becomes more violent as his affections are rejected. Touching, funny and disturbing, this feature stars Paddy Considine as the stranger, with wonderful performances by the two young leads Andrew Shim and Ben Marshall. Bob Hoskins makes an appearance as a visiting teacher. Soundtrack features music by Beck, Beth Orton and Billy Bragg.

results.title: A Rock climb
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: The film describes the activities of a rock-climbing Explorer Unit from Phoenix, Arizona - the Kachinas. First their equipment and techniques are demonstrated and then the camera records the actual climb of a sheer peak in the Arizona Desert, a peak never before climbed by man.

results.title: A Road is built
results.brief_description: A study of the use of heavy mechanical equipment during the building of a road in the timber country near Noogee in Victoria. Bulldozers, rooters, power-graders, and heavy earth-moving machines are seen at work as the road takes shape.
